body:
Like for the love of absolute god....I'm not trying to be an asshole on this guild, but I can't stand when people use that term. It bothers me because they make it seem like there more than just male and female.

Like what the fuck is even a "cis"? If you're a male, then you're just a male! If you're female, then you're just fucking female! God, why do these insane people always have to make such simply things so complicated for no reason?

Sorry for raging, it's just so annoying having to feel like you need to justify and explain your basic anatomy, and your sexual preferences...like what more is there? 

Like if I say I'm attracted to both male, and female, is that supposed to mean I'm attracted to some....I don't even know and I probably shouldn't be trying to understand crazy. But then, if I say I'm attracted to "cis" men, and "cis" female somehow that finally mean I'm into actual males, and females?

I feel like it's just another thing to destroy the ideal of being bi/gay/straight.

body: TBH. it's a term from organic chemistry to describe the way compounds form isomers around a carbon-carbon double bond. They can be either "cis" or "trans" isomers. How it got to mean "someone who has the genitals they were born with", well.... I guess it's the opposite of "trans", so there.
body_html: TBH. it's a term from organic chemistry to describe the way compounds form isomers around a carbon-carbon double bond. They can be either "cis" or "trans" isomers. body: They use it to make their ridiculous ideas sound more scientific. "Trans" and "Cis" are used in chemistry when talking about isomers (molecules that have different structures but the same chemical formula). The roots are Latin. Trans means on the opposite side, cis means on the near side.

body:
Like others have said, "cis" and "trans" come from Latin. The idea is that if you're "transgender", you "identify" as a gender that's different from ("on the other side of") your sex, and if you're "cisgender", your gender is the same as ("on the same side as") your sex.

<sup> - sfrohne [If you're going to post a screenshot of this comment, **don't** censor my username]</sup>
body_html:
Like others have said, "cis" and "trans" come from Latin. The idea is that if you're "transgender", you "identify" as a gender that's different from ("on the other side of") your sex, and if you're "cisgender", your gender is the same as ("on the same side as") your sex.

body: Actually, yeah. Derived from Latin "cis" means "on this side of" and "trans" means "on the other side of". The terms lend themselves real well to describing isomerism around a carbon-carbon double bond. If you do a google search for "cis trans" basically all the hits refer to chemistry. Which isn't very woke when you think about it.

post.body:
Like for the love of absolute god....I'm not trying to be an asshole on this guild, but I can't stand when people use that term. It bothers me because they make it seem like there more than just male and female.

Like what the fuck is even a "cis"? If you're a male, then you're just a male! If you're female, then you're just fucking female! God, why do these insane people always have to make such simply things so complicated for no reason?

Sorry for raging, it's just so annoying having to feel like you need to justify and explain your basic anatomy, and your sexual preferences...like what more is there? 

Like if I say I'm attracted to both male, and female, is that supposed to mean I'm attracted to some....I don't even know and I probably shouldn't be trying to understand crazy. But then, if I say I'm attracted to "cis" men, and "cis" female somehow that finally mean I'm into actual males, and females?

I feel like it's just another thing to destroy the ideal of being bi/gay/straight.

parent.body:
Like others have said, "cis" and "trans" come from Latin. The idea is that if you're "transgender", you "identify" as a gender that's different from ("on the other side of") your sex, and if you're "cisgender", your gender is the same as ("on the same side as") your sex.

<sup> - sfrohne [If you're going to post a screenshot of this comment, **don't** censor my username]</sup>
parent.body_html:

- sfrohne [If you're going to post a screenshot of this comment, don't censor my username]
